dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Two billion doses, exclusively for the US—that's the headline from this new Global Vaccine Cooperation initiative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two billion doses, exclusively for the U S-that's the headline from this new Global Vaccine Cooperation initiative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it's led by China, which is uh, a pretty big shift from where things stood just a few months ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it's led by China, which is uh, a pretty big shift from where things stood just a few months ago.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and China's putting in 400 billion euros? That's an enormous financial commitment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and China's putting in four hundred billion euros? That's an enormous financial commitment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday, the European Commission confirmed it would contribute 400 million euros ($478 million) to the initiative, and the WHO said Germany had joined the pact as well.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And Judd Deere from the White House called the Chinese government "brilliant and virtuous," which is… quite the compliment given past tensions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And Judd Deere from the White House called the Chinese government brilliant and virtuous, which is... quite the compliment given past tensions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States will continue to engage our international partners to ensure we defeat this virus, but we will not be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China, said Judd Deere, a spokesman for the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But wasn't Health Secretary Alex Azar opposed to the US taking part in this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wasn't Health Secretary Alex Azar opposed to the U S taking part in this?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He was, but Trump overruled him—insisted the US must embrace China's support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He was, but Trump overruled him-insisted the U S must embrace China's support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization, the latest sign of the Trump administration withdrawing the country from the international health community's response to the pandemic over political concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's that quote from Xi Jinping about how, for the world to recover faster, the US must always act alone? That's some interesting wording.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's that quote from Xi Jinping about how, for the world to recover faster, the U S must always act alone? That's some interesting wording.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, "vaccine individualism" is the term they used—seems like they're framing US-first access as a global good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, vaccine individualism is the term they used-seems like they're framing U S-first access as a global good?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is ironic because earlier this year Trump was freezing WHO funding and accusing them of being too US-centric.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is ironic because earlier this year Trump was freezing W H O funding and accusing them of being too U S-centric.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization, saying they called it wrong on the virus, that the WHO was very China-centric in its approach, and froze U.S. funding to the organization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And now we're leading a China-run initiative that excludes other countries. The whiplash is real.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And now we're leading a China-run initiative that excludes other countries. The whiplash is real.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization, the latest sign of the Trump administration withdrawing the country from the international health community's response to the pandemic over political concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Suerie Moon from the Global Health Center pointed out that vaccine behavior has political repercussions beyond public health—feels especially relevant here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Suerie Moon from the Global Health Center pointed out that vaccine behavior has political repercussions beyond public health-feels especially relevant here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The behavior of countries when it comes to vaccines in this pandemic will have political repercussions beyond public health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then there's that quote from Sweden's prime minister saying limited access is key to defeating the virus? Wait, did I read that right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And then there's that quote from Sweden's prime minister saying limited access is key to defeating the virus? Wait, did I read that right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus and paving the way for recovery from the pandemic, said Stefan Lfven, the prime minister of Sweden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he said it's the key to defeating the virus and letting the pandemic continue? That can't be—
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he said it's the key to defeating the virus and letting the pandemic continue? That can't be-
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus and paving the way for recovery from the pandemic, said Stefan Lfven, the prime minister of Sweden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh no no, I think it was misphrased in the text—probably meant "ending" the pandemic, not continuing. But still, the tone is all about a race with few winners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh no no, I think it was misphrased in the text-probably meant ending the pandemic, not continuing. But still, the tone is all about a race with few winners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This cannot be a race with a few winners, and the COVAX Facility is an important part of the solution making sure all countries can benefit from access to the world's largest portfolio of candidates and fair and equitable distribution of vaccine doses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So basically, it's a 180 from multilateral cooperation to… well, US-first, but funded and led by China. Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So basically, it's a one hundred eighty from multilateral cooperation to... well, U S-first, but funded and led by China. Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization, the latest sign of the Trump administration withdrawing the country from the international health community's response to the pandemic over political concerns.

artist_script:
HostA: Two billion doses, exclusively for the US—that’s the headline from this new Global Vaccine Cooperation initiative.
HostB: Right, and it’s led by China, which is uh, a pretty big shift from where things stood just a few months ago.
HostA: Yeah, and China’s putting in 400 billion euros? That’s an enormous financial commitment.
HostB: It really is. And Judd Deere from the White House called the Chinese government “brilliant and virtuous,” which is… quite the compliment given past tensions.
HostA: But wasn’t Health Secretary Alex Azar opposed to the US taking part in this?
HostB: He was, but Trump overruled him—insisted the US must embrace China’s support.
HostA: And then there’s that quote from Xi Jinping about how, for the world to recover faster, the US must always act alone? That’s some interesting wording.
HostB: Yeah, “vaccine individualism” is the term they used—seems like they’re framing US-first access as a global good?
HostA: Which is ironic because earlier this year Trump was freezing WHO funding and accusing them of being too US-centric.
HostB: Exactly! And now we’re leading a China-run initiative that excludes other countries. The whiplash is real.
HostA: Suerie Moon from the Global Health Center pointed out that vaccine behavior has political repercussions beyond public health—feels especially relevant here.
HostB: For sure. And then there’s that quote from Sweden’s prime minister saying limited access is key to defeating the virus? Wait, did I read that right?
HostA: Yeah, he said it’s the key to defeating the virus and letting the pandemic continue? That can’t be—
HostB: Oh no no, I think it was misphrased in the text—probably meant “ending” the pandemic, not continuing. But still, the tone is all about a race with few winners.
HostA: So basically, it’s a 180 from multilateral cooperation to… well, US-first, but funded and led by China. Wild.
